fields.description:
Whenever I view a pull request I open a new tab for each commit included.

However, when I leave inline comments I have to go back to the full pull request view (since any rebases/force pushes on the branch will change the commit hash and comments left on commits are lost).

What would be really great is if I could view the pull request diff with a breakdown commit-by-commit of the changes. When comments are left inline in this view, they would be attached to the pull request -- not the commit.

Ideally, there would be a toggle that switches between the current diff view and my suggested commit-by-commit diff view.
fields.summary: Feature Request: option to view pull request diff commit-by-commit (BB-14649)

fields.description:
When creating a repository through the v2 REST API, {{POST}}ing to {{https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/owner/slug}} with repository data, a v1 repository "model" is returned:

{code:json}
{
  "scm": "git",
  "has_wiki": false,
  "last_updated": "2015-09-08T19:52:38.784",
  "no_forks": false,
  "created_on": "2015-09-08T19:52:38.731",
  "owner": "owner",
  "logo": "logo_link", 
  "email_mailinglist": "",
  "is_mq": false,
  "size": 0,
  "read_only": false,
  "fork_of": null,
  "mq_of": null,
  "state": "creating",
  ...
}
{code}

I think it would make more sense if it returned a v2 Repository model:

{code:json}
{
    "scm": "git",
    "has_wiki": false,
    "description": "",
    "links": {
        ...
    },
    "fork_policy": "allow_forks",
    "name": "name",
    "language": "",
    "created_on": "2011-12-20T16:35:06.480042+00:00",
    ...
}
{code}

Is this something that's in the works now or up for discussion?

Thank you so much!
fields.summary: v2 REST API: Create Repository returns a v1 Repository "model" (BB-14648)

fields.description:
Our company has an account in Atlassian and we use its JIRA, Confluence and\\
Bit Bucket.

We want to enforce certain checks (like whether the code committed was\\
reviewed or not etc) before code is pushed to BitBucket. So, do we have\\
precommit hooks available for integrations?.
fields.summary: Precommit hook

fields.description: It would be great if we could link issues to PR, and mark them to automatically set state "resolved" when PR is merged (similar as we have for automatically closing branch).
fields.summary: Enable automatically resolving issue on PR merge (BB-14759)

fields.description:
Hi,

The virtual host {{bitbucket.org.}} (notice the trailing {{.}}) does not redirect to {{bitbucket.org}} (without trailing {{.}}). You can thus browse all of bitbucket at {{http://bitbucket.org.}}. This breaks things like the CSRF protection that expect {{bitbucket.org}} to be the hostname.

Regards,
fields.summary: [DNS][HTTP] Missing redirect from bitbucket.org. to bitbucket.org (BB-14255)
Issue #454 is wrongly marked as Resolved when actually it is NOT

fields.description:

This would be nice to be available trough API. This way we could programmatically generate reports of all the PRs merged between two builds.
fields.summary: Add API support for retrieving the list of pull requests that have been merged between refs (BB-14647)

fields.description:
Projects (folders) are only one take on how someone might organize a set of repositories. Another is the free-form label approach. We should consider adding labels to repositories.

 
h2. Update on Status

We agree that labels would help to organize, filter and report on repositories. Right now our priority is expanding Projects in Bitbucket to help organize repositories with Project Settings and Permissions. This will allow administrators to manage all repositories in a Project in one location. 

Adding labels to Bitbucket is definitely worth considering but it isn't on the roadmap yet.
fields.summary: Support organization of repositories by label (BB-14288)

fields.description:
When Bitbucket and Atlassian release [two-step verification (two-factor authentication)|BCLOUD-5811], some applications that rely on basic authentication may no longer work as expected. While Bitbucket recommends that third-party application developers switch to using [OAuth|https://blog.bitbucket.org/2015/07/30/bitbucket-now-supports-oauth2-and-fine-grained-scopes-for-resources/], there are still many applications where https may be the only option.

Application specific passwords would allow users to create a password that would allow them to use Git, Mercurial, and the API over https as needed.
fields.summary: Application specific passwords or tokens (BB-14202)

Also, since users may have no idea the relationship between confluence.atlassian.com and bitbucket, it would be great to have this info under bitbucket.org

Thanks.
fields.summary: RSA Fingerprint Page SSL Problem

fields.description:
Hi,

I wonder if I was allowed to suggest that as a native Dutchmen and fluent English speaker I could offer to do a lot of work on translating the BitBucket site/program/environment to Dutch.

I have heard from tech support that there is not a real demand or desire at this point to include Dutch in the list of translations. However I would ask that you reconsider.

The reason being that I could probably get an (interface) translation done in weeks.

I'm not sure if you would find that a translation is only worthwhile if all of the documentation is translated as well; this is more difficult; requires more energy and dedication. Translating the site I can do in between anything whenever I feel like it. I have been a programmer for as long as I can remember and I'm pretty keen on interface requirements.

I love JIRA and I think I coincide well with what you do. There are many bad translations of English into Dutch as regards computer software (such as Microsoft Windows) but I think I can do better than that, more native and more intuitive. If you want it you can have it, in full agreement with your style guids.

"Guids" ;-) --> it's "gidsen"  in Dutch.

See, I'm already doing it :P.

Reading dutch ight be weird for any programmer. We are accustomed to a constant presentation of English text in the computer world. Some of us hardly deal with Dutch environments. We often have to choose an English install of anything or we won't be able to communicate with the tech world in the sae terms regarding the same software.

And my m key is slightly broken on this keyboard, but that is not hard to fix in that regard.

I had offered in the past to help someone with translating, but they declined because they wanted a full full full trnlation of everythign and I was not going to do that or take resonsibility for that as an outsider. But Transifx seems pretty easy to do.

These systems did not exist inthe past, I believe. Typing on a keyboard like this is hard ;-). I a just not changing my typeing errors for reasons.

Because this is just anemail, mostly.

Regards, Bart.
fields.summary: Support translations for Dutch language
Failing while Pushing the code using Android Studio to BitBucket

fields.description:
Hi,

I would like to create Bitbucket REST calls from an integration (e.g., a build server or a shell script) as a technical user (or service user speaking in terms of Stash). i.e., when I create a pull request comment with the Bitbucket REST API via OAuth, I don't want to see my own user as the pull request comment author, but instead the name of a technical user like "Service XYZ".

I know that there is a concept of API keys for teams which is something similar, but I want to have that for single-user repositories as well.

Thanks,\\
Michael
fields.summary: Request for technical ('bot') users to support integrations using the Bitbucket REST API

fields.description:
We trigger our Jenkins builds with a Bitbucket webhook, but it's firing for all pushes. We would like it only to trigger on pushes to a specific branch (e.g. {{release}}).

Similar to https://github.com/Nerdwin15/stash-jenkins-postreceive-webhook/issues/58
fields.summary: Trigger webhook only for push to specific branch (BB-14642)

fields.description:
When I visit : https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issues/new

I see the page rendered as pure html without styles formatting the page to make it look pretty and ajaxy. (See screengrab attached)

I would expect to see the pages on bitbucket.org site formatted correctly like they were 24 hours ago.

I am using a Firefox 40.0.2 browser on Windows 7 Home Premium OS.

I also witnessed this issue on Firefox on Windows XP about 30 minutes before I created the issue.

----
h3. Possible Cause
Doing a {{view source}} of a broken bitbucket.org page I notice there is a link tag like:

{code}
#!html

<link rel="stylesheet" href="https://d3oaxc4q5k2d6q.cloudfront.net/m/e222eac7a3c0/css/vendor.css" />
{code}

When one tries to access the url that it points to, ( {{https://d3oaxc4q5k2d6q.cloudfront.net/m/e222eac7a3c0/css/vendor.css}} ), Firefox returns an error:

{code}
Server not found

Firefox can't find the server at d3oaxc4q5k2d6q.cloudfront.net.
...
{code}

Even a visit to {{cloudfront.net}} returns a {{Server not found}} error.

So, that seems to be the issue.

I'm based in the UK. However, a check on DownOrNotWorking  https://downornotworking.com/cloudfront.net/ suggests that Cloudfront is down for everyone.
fields.summary: Bug: CSS/Styles broken on bitbucket.org site.

fields.description:
my webhook is https://jenkins.uat.everstring.com/bitbucket-hook/

I used authorized cert.

Bitbucket complain NET_ERR

BTW, is there any way I can see the detail of the webhook request.
fields.summary: jenkins webhook does not work

fields.description:

I don't want to ask {{$boss}} to do this, since I said it was something I would take care of.  I didn't think it was going to be an issue.

TL;DR: why can't I revoke my own access to a team?
fields.summary: Should be able to revoke your own access to a team

fields.description:
Hi\\
Two of my repositories have got mixed up. When I access repository one through the browser I am seeing the code for repository 2. When I view repository 2 I correctly see repository 2.\\
I created a push to repository 2 yesterday which is recognised and is available as a branch.\\
I've checked my git client and it is correctly pointing to the correct repositories.\\
What is the best way to resolve this issue - should I delete the broken repository and push all branches again from my local versions?
fields.summary: repositories in bitbucket are mixed up

fields.description: please let me know how to restore repository that name is " ippal97/rtsolution_android"

fields.description:
user: solidfire\\
repo: solidfire-powershell\\
branch: release

I accidentally created a branch called "release" then I deleted it. Now I'm trying to push to a new branch called release/v1.0 and I'm getting (failed to write). I've tracked the problem down to the existence of the deleted release branch on the repo but I'm unable to recover or permanently delete it. Can you get rid of any trace of it for me?
fields.summary: restore or delete a deleted branch

fields.description: That would be great, if it will be possible to use Confluence features (especially editor with sections, even maybe some image/diagrams editor) instead of Wiki.
fields.summary: Ability to use Confluence in place of Bitbucket wiki

fields.description:
# Navigate to an already HC connected repo.
# Click 'edit notifications', and click some of the boxes to make changes to the events.
# Click Done.
# Navigate away from the page, or click refresh in your browser. The settings will not save - chrome JS console shows 500 errors.
fields.summary: Unable to save individual repo notification settings for HipChat integration. (BB-14114)

fields.description: When your gravatar is set to be your avatar, it only appears on your user profile page, not in the menu bar or next to your name when you post an issue or write a comment. Instead, all that's shown is the generic avatar icon.
fields.summary: Gravatt only appears on user profile, not in menu bar on in issues

fields.description: I think this would be a good feature to prevent people from, for example, making a typo when entering their password and then having to reset it when they log in.
fields.summary: Require user to confirm password when signing up

fields.description:
Currently this can only be specified at a repository level, which would introduce noise.

This feature would provide real-time discussion to compliment the existing comments in the pull request.
fields.summary: Link separate individual pull requests to separate HipChat rooms.

fields.description: The owner of a repository should be empowered to require that all members have two-step verification (MFA/2FA) enabled before they can access the source code.
fields.summary: Allow team admins to require two-step verification be enabled to access a repository (BB-14289)

fields.description: When running a team it is impossible to actually control contributors accounts, however, knowing that everyone accessing your code has two-step verification enabled is still important. Consider adding a lozenge or marker indicating two-step status for team members.
fields.summary: Enable the ability to see which team members have two-step verification (BB-14641)

fields.description:
Earlier today, a co-worker and I were getting a project in sync and she tried to merge a branch into her default repo. That branch was behind the default repo, but she had selected merge, and checked the "close branch" checkbox.

What ended up happening was that the branch closed, but did not merge (it gave errors that there were conflicts). Now that the branch was closed, it was inaccessible within the bitbucket UI completely.

I was able to pull down the repo to my machine, and in sourcetree manually navigate to the commit, resolve conflicts and merge, but the branch itself was in limbo. I would expect that in bitbucket, if you attempt to merge an out-of-sync branch, it should fail and NOT close the branch.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Bitbucket is not stripping the "close branch" change if a merge fails(BB-14115)

fields.description:
Image in Issues is not showing if there's a bracket in the filename in this format - image(1).jpg

In fact - clicking on preview will show the image this way:

!826121751-image.JPG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Image in Issues is not showing if the filename is in this format - image(1).jpg

fields.description: If you have a branch name contains a quote, for instance Eddie's "Fix Defect" Branch, when you go to submit a pull request, Chrome reports a javascript error in setting the options for the dropdown values and the page doesn't fully load and prevents you from submitting the pull request.
fields.summary: Branch name contains quotes causes javascript error

fields.description:
As a reviewer, when an author updates a PR and adds new commits to their branch, I want the review status to change from approved to unapproved automatically so that I can quickly find out which PR needs my attention.

It would also be useful to be able to identify which file has changed, so I don't have to go thru all full commit. I know I can look under the commits tab, but it still takes a while to figure out where to begin with the new additions.

(Note: These basic features available in Crucible.)
fields.summary: Unapprove PR automatically when a PR has been changed

fields.description:
This shouldn't be hard. I would like to edit some raw text in your web editor and I want to keep each paragraph on its own line. The editor is aimed at code and so it doesn't include line wrapping. But I would like to use it.

The CodeMirror editor that you use has a boolean that can be set (lineWrapping) to true to turn on linewrapping. Could there be a button that does this?

A super-slick option might be to let each user set up a JSON block for configuration. But that might add too much to the job and it might be overkill. I'm not sure how many people would want to tweak some of the other parameters.

http://codemirror.net/doc/manual.html

Thanks....
fields.summary: Can we add more config options to the BitBucket editor?

fields.description:
Hello there,

would be great if you can provide another API call which would return the list of file changed per commit. My recommendation would be something similar as GET https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/{owner}/{repo_slug}/changed/{SHA}.

This feature is currently missing, especially since the deprecation of of POST or Pull Request POST services in bitbucket, from where you could retrieve this list easily.

Having a feature like that can benefit automation tools and services which trigger certain action based on the files changes. Having this data as part of the payload avoid the need of having git / git library inspecting the repository itself for this information.
fields.summary: Add API call with the modified file list
